message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Bank Enterprise Survey from 2016, we analyze the impact of firm characteristics on productivity growth in the manufacturing sector in Brazil.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "The study draws on data from the DHS conducted in India and Bangladesh to examine the association between women's autonomy and maternal healthcare utilization.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We used the Multi-Country Demographic and Health Surveys (M-DHS) to investigate the factors associated with contraceptive discontinuation among married women in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Multi-Country Demographic and Health Surveys (M-DHS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "To address this issue, we merge two datasets: UK Quarterly National Accounts (QNA) and a novel dataset of online job vacancies scraped from major job websites in the UK.", "dataset": ["UK Quarterly National Accounts", "online job vacancies"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Afrobarometer survey conducted in 2018, we analyze the determinants of citizens' perceptions of government effectiveness in African countries.", "dataset": ["Afrobarometer survey"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We combine primary household survey data collected specifically for the purpose of this study with data from the National Agricultural Seeds Council (NASC) to evaluate the impact of an agro-dealer training intervention in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["National Agricultural Seeds Council (NASC)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Exploiting variation in the timing and intensity of social security system reforms in Mexico, we use administrative data from the Mexican Social Security Institute to estimate the impact of social security coverage expansion on formal sector employment.", "dataset": ["Mexican Social Security Institute"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effect of the expansion of electrification on healthcare utilization in rural areas using two datasets: Pakistan Social and Living Standards Measurement Survey (PSLM) and Pakistan Integrated Household Energy Consumption Survey (PIHECS).", "dataset": ["Pakistan Social and Living Standards Measurement Survey (PSLM)", "Pakistan Integrated Household Energy Consumption Survey (PIHECS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using firm-level survey data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we examine the relationship between tax morale and informality in Central America.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a novel dataset combining unit record data from three national survey programs (NATSEM, HILDA, and SEED), to investigate the association between siblings' educational outcomes and intergenerational transfers in Australia.", "dataset": ["NATSEM", "HILDA", "SEED"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
